definitions.definition: a device or substance that is used to join two things together so as to prevent them from coming apart or to prevent anything from passing between them.
examples: blue smoke from the exhaust suggests worn valve seals

definitions.definition: the state or fact of being joined or rendered impervious with a seal.
examples: many fittings have tapered threads for a better seal

definitions.definition: the water standing in the trap of a drain to prevent sewer gas from backing up through the drain, considered in terms of its depth.
a piece of wax, lead, or other material with an individual design stamped into it, attached to a document to show that it has come from the person who claims to have issued it.
examples: emblem, symbol, insignia, device, badge, crest, coat of arms, mark, monogram, stamp the king put his seal on the letter

definitions.definition: a design resembling a seal embossed in paper as a guarantee of authenticity.
an engraved device used for stamping a design that authenticates a document.
a decorative adhesive stamp.
a thing regarded as a confirmation or guarantee of something.
examples: the International Monetary Fund is likely to give a seal of approval to the Mexican plan
synonyms: clearance "the project cannot begin without the committee's seal"

definitions.definition: the obligation on a priest not to divulge anything said during confession.
examples: I was told under the seal

definitions.definition: fasten or close securely.
examples: he folded it, sealed the envelope, and walked to the mailbox
synonyms: bolt More"she quietly sealed the door behind her"stop up
plug "seal each bottle while it is hot"

definitions.definition: prevent something from escaping by closing a container or opening.
isolate an area by preventing or monitoring entrance to and exit from it.
examples: the police have sealed off the area in search of the attackers

definitions.definition: apply a nonporous coating to (a surface) to make it impervious.
examples: seal the finish with a satin varnish

definitions.definition: fry (food) briefly in hot fat to prevent it from losing too much of its moisture during subsequent cooking.
examples: heat the oil and seal the lamb on both sides

definitions.definition: conclude, establish, or secure (something) definitively, excluding the possibility of reversal or loss.
examples: to seal the deal he offered Thornton a place on the board of the nascent company

definitions.definition: fix a piece of wax or lead stamped with a design to (a document) to authenticate it.
a fish-eating aquatic mammal with a streamlined body and feet developed as flippers, returning to land to breed or rest.
another term for sealskin.
hunt for seals.
a member of an elite force within the US Navy specializing in guerrilla warfare and counterinsurgency.
